title: Letters to the Editor:  One-Upping John Rockefeller
text:
Kudos to Allan Ripp for gratuitously, unexpectedly and discreetly handing $20 bills to myriad "people going about their jobs with no expectations of being personally thanked" ("How I Reached the Tipping Point," op-ed, Dec. 9). Mr. Ripp's practice recalls that of multimillionaire John D. Rockefeller, the richest man in the world for some time, known for bestowing a dime on many people he came across.

Mr. Ripp, however, is far, far ahead of Rockefeller. According to the Minneapolis Fed's inflation calculator, one of J.D.'s 1920s-vintage dimes had the buying power of around $1.50 in today's currency.

Bill Apple

New York
